str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shine, give light. A primary verb; to beam, i.e. Radiate brilliancy.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shine, give light. A primary verb; to beam, i.e. Radiate brilliancy.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Light, luster, illumination, enlightenment. From photizo; illumination.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
